result.execSummary:
The defendant Constance C Koenig was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court sentences the Defendant to pay a fine of $25 + costs = $484.50 + $100 domestic abuse surcharge = $584.50, due in $25 increments per month, beginning 9/30/15 and on the last day of the month until paid in full. Non-payment results in a 12 day jail term, with Huber privileges consecutive. 

 Submit DNA Sample

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Constance C Koenig

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: From Bookkeeping to Defendant RE: Unable to Receipt Check/Money Order
with attached elements and criminal case settlement

Case called at 9:31 am [Clerk SH] (Case was scheduled for STC)
[Reserve Judge Mark A. Frankel presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Constance C Koenig in court with Attorney Sylvie Dahnert. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.

Court sentences the Defendant to pay a fine of $25 + costs = $484.50 + $100 domestic abuse surcharge = $584.50, due in $25 incriments per month, beginning 9/30/15 and on the last day of the month until paid in full. Non-payment results in a 12 day jail term, with Huber privileges consecutive. 
Submit DNA Sample
1 day credit for time served given if failure to pay is served
Recess: 10:02 am

Case called at 1:32 pm [sf]
Defendant Constance C Koenig in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Sylvie Dahnert appearing on behalf of the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office. Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney Dahnert verifies that the defendant qualifies for SPD.
Address and DOB information verified by the Court. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, maximum penalties recited
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant. 
Upon stipulation, the Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires $1,000.00 signature bond, with conditions: 
-No possession or consumption of alcohol 
-No presence in bars, taverns or package houses
-Take all medications as prescribed
-No acts or threats of violence
-No discussion of the facts of the case with John Horn
-The Defendant is to report and comply with SCRAM alcohol monitoring program as administered by Wisconsin Community Services.  The Court orders the defendant to SCRAM monitoring through WCS, with the consideration of Remote Breath as an alternative only when WCS verifies that a defendant's work environment or health condition prohibits the SCRAM bracelet. The Defendant is to comply with all SCRAM Program conditions of participation including payment of program costs and fees. **If in custody, release on SCRAM only.**

Recess: 1:37 pm
NEXT: (Notices to be mailed)
PTC: 7/29/15 at 9:00 am
Status: 8/14/15 at 9:30 am
